content:
© 2024 Accordion     CONFIDENTIAL
Weather analysis to drive growth strategy
1
Analyzed the impact of weather catastrophic events on the business 
performance and categorized revenue streams into recurring and 
non-recurring to inform growth strategy.
Property restoration company that offers internal and external building 
damage repairs and planned maintenance services

© 2024 Accordion     CONFIDENTIAL
Picture this…
You are in a property restore business with impact of external weather events, but you do not know what is the 
true impact of the weather events. You’re looking to understand how business is getting impacted by the weather 
events and which businesses, geographies are least/most affected by the business and forecast future growth 
with scenario analysis
Property restoration company needs to analyze impact of 
weather on their business
2
Your value is enhanced.
• You were able to quantity that there was a 20-25% revenue addition due to impact of CAT events on your 
business and identify business segments which are least/most impacted due to weather events.
• You identified category/ type of CAT events that are impacting business revenues significantly across 
geographies
• You were able to estimate proportion of earnings that would be generated in normal weather scenario and 
adverse weather scenarios
CONSUMER
KEY RESULT   
•
Identified 20-25% 
proportion of revenue 
driven by catastrophic 
weather events
•
Categorized states 
into low to high CAT 
impact categories and 
identified 7 CAT 
events with high 
positive/ negative 
business impact
VALUE LEVERS PULLED
•
Weather data 
consolidation at zip 
code
•
Existing Dataset 
assessment
•
Evaluation of CAT 
events impact on 
revenue 
2
You turn to Accordion
We partner with your team to identify the impact of CAT (catastrophe) events across different business segments 
and geographies, including:
1) Exploring different sources including government websites to extract weather data at zip code granularity and 
normalization of event data
2) Evaluating of impact of CAT events and their magnitude across states for different business segments
3) Identifying key CAT events impacting the business revenue

© 2024 Accordion     CONFIDENTIAL
Methodology/Approach
33
Extracted weather events data along with associated beginning and ending coordinates 
from NOAA weather
Mapped weather events with ZIP Code based on the coordinates leveraging API tools 
(Google Geo-coding API and Bing API)
Compiled the two dataset and merged them to create a unified dataset containing 
weather evets along with respective ZIP codes
Analysis Approach
Claims data for 2 years is considered for the analysis, based on the date of First notice 
of loss for the respective claims
Built a Regression model considering claim amount as the dependent variable and 
count of weather events as the independent variable. 
Significant events are considered based on the 80% confidence level (p value < 0.2)
Identified Baseline revenue (gross revenue which could be generated without any 
catastrophic weather event) and CAT Claim Revenue (revenue generated due to 
significant weather events)

© 2024 Accordion     CONFIDENTIAL
